intro: Loeselia glandulosa subsp. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular loeselia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
